definitions: To pursue or approach an animal or person stealthily, typically in order to kill or capture it or them.
To harass or persecute (someone) with unwanted and obsessive attention.
To walk with a stiff, haughty, or angry stride.
examples: The hunter stalked his prey through the dense forest.
She was stalked by an obsessed fan for months.
He stalked out of the room after the argument.
